basics.name: Davide Paolino
basics.label: PhD Student in Active Matter Physics
basics.summary: First year PhD student in Physics of Complex Systems with a focus on statistical physics, computational methods, and stochastic processes. My primary research interests lie in the applications of statistical physics to glassy systems, machine learning, and neuroscience. I am currently working under the supervision of L. Berthier at the Gulliver Lab, ESPCI, PSL. The topic of my PhD is numerical simulations of active matter. I am passionate about teaching, coding, and sports.
